title: 114_hr3265
content: The Act is titled the "Student Financial Aid Simplification Act" and includes a section on FAFSA simplification. Section 483 of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to simplify the FAFSA process for students who are taxpayers or dependents of taxpayers. Beginning in the academic year 2017-2018, these students may be eligible for financial assistance regardless of certain requirements. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to simplify FAFSA for taxpayer students or dependents. Eligibility for financial assistance can be determined by authorizing the Secretary to obtain income data from the IRS and submitting supplemental information. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to simplify FAFSA for taxpayer students or dependents. Institutions of higher education and States can receive necessary information from the Secretary for loan applications and financial aid awards. Students applying for financial assistance must submit additional information as required by the Secretary to determine eligibility and administer programs. The Secretary can provide information to institutions and States for loan applications and financial aid awards under the Higher Education Act of 1965. Students must submit additional details like citizenship, dependency status, and education history for eligibility determination. Regulations will be prescribed by the Secretary. The Secretary will prescribe regulations necessary for this subsection, with certain rulemaking requirements not applicable. SEC. 3. AMENDMENTS TO INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1986. Section 6103(l) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to allow the Secretary to disclose return information to the Department of Education for determining the need and eligibility of a student for federal student financial aid based on income information. The amendment to Section 6103(l) of the Internal Revenue Code allows the Secretary to disclose taxpayer information to the Department of Education for determining federal student financial aid eligibility based on income data. The amendment allows the Department of Education to use taxpayer information to process student loan applications and determine eligibility for Federal student financial aid under specific provisions of the Higher Education Act of 1965.
